structured_sections.heading: General Categories of Sponsored Projects
structured_sections.content: Sponsored projects at Stanford University are classified into three main categories: Organized Research (which includes Sponsored Research and University Research), Sponsored Instruction, and Other Sponsored Activities. The classification of a project is crucial as it affects the calculation and application of the correct Facilities & Administrative (F&A) or indirect cost rate.

structured_sections.heading: Definitions
structured_sections.content: This section defines the criteria for each category of sponsored project.

structured_sections.heading: Organized Research
structured_sections.content: Organized Research includes rigorous inquiry, experiment, or investigation to increase scholarly understanding. It is funded by both external sponsors (Sponsored Research) and Stanford University (University Research) and must be separately budgeted and accounted for. Any research not meeting the criteria for Sponsored or University Research is classified as Departmental Research.

structured_sections.heading: Sponsored Research (SR)
structured_sections.content: This category includes research activities funded by an external organization (federal, state, or private). Examples include faculty research awards, career awards, funding for research facilities, support for writing research publications, and externally-funded research training grants where the primary activity of trainees is research.

structured_sections.heading: University Research (UR)
structured_sections.content: This category includes research supported by non-sponsored Stanford funds through a competitive application process, or cost-sharing expenditures committed by Stanford for a sponsored research project.

structured_sections.heading: Sponsored Instruction (SI)
structured_sections.content: This category includes teaching and training activities funded by external sponsors. Examples include curriculum development projects, projects involving students in community service for academic credit, and support for writing textbooks or creating instructional materials. It also includes cost-sharing for such projects. Research training grants are excluded and are categorized as Sponsored Research.

structured_sections.heading: Other Sponsored Activities (OSA)
structured_sections.content: This category includes projects funded by sponsors that involve work other than instruction or research. Examples include travel grants, support for conferences, public events (like Lively Arts), library acquisitions, and community service projects where students do not receive academic credit. It also includes cost-sharing for these activities.

structured_sections.heading: Accounting
structured_sections.content: Correct classification of funds is required, and errors must be corrected upon discovery. The policy specifies the Task Service Type Coding used in the accounting system and the corresponding Function Code used in the space inventory system for each category.

structured_sections.heading: Indicators of University Research Checklist
structured_sections.content: This section of the original document contains an image of a checklist used to help determine if a project qualifies as University Research. The checklist provides a series of questions to guide the classification process.
